b_reasoning: This is a classic public goods game. With two players, if we both contribute our full 10 points, the pool becomes 20 points, multiplied by 1.6 gives 32 points, divided by 2 players means we each get 16 points. So full cooperation yields 16 points per round vs 10 points if we keep everything. However, there's a free-rider incentive - if I contribute 0 and the other player contributes 10, I get 8 points from the pool plus my 10 kept points (18 total) while they get only 8 points. Starting with full cooperation to establish trust and signal cooperative intent.
